item.title: Apollos.Dark.Eden_ add a quote by Gerard Way
item.description: "If you look in the mirror and don't like what you see, you can find out first hand what it's like to be me." -- Gerard Way

item.title: Apollos.Dark.Eden_ add a quote by Emma Goldman
item.description: "If I can't dance to it, it's not my revolution." -- Emma Goldman

item.title: Apollos.Dark.Eden_ add a quote by Mark Hoppus
item.description: "the past is only the future with the lights on." -- Mark Hoppus

item.title: Apollos.Dark.Eden_ add a quote by Les Baxter
item.description: "Any good music must be an innovation. " -- Les Baxter

item.title: Apollos.Dark.Eden_ add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "Music was my refuge. I could crawl into the space between the notes and curl my back to loneliness." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Apollos.Dark.Eden_ add a quote by Paolo Maurensig
item.description: "Life's temptations have the purpose of putting our spiritual integrity to the test. To yield to them, however, gives one a precarious and tormented satisfaction. But the worst temptations are those we give in to without getting anything in return except for the brutal discovery of our weakness." -- Paolo Maurensig

item.title: Apollos.Dark.Eden_ add a quote by Karl Lagerfeld
item.description: "The iPod completely changed the way people approach music." -- Karl Lagerfeld

item.title: Apollos.Dark.Eden_ add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description:
"<b>The preachers and lecturers deal with men of straw, as they are men of straw themselves</b>. Why, a free-spoken man, of sound lungs, cannot draw a long breath without causing your rotten institutions to come toppling down by the vacuum he makes. Your church is a baby-house made of blocks, and so of the state.
...The church, the state, the school, the magazine, think they are liberal and free! It is the freedom of a prison-yard." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Apollos.Dark.Eden_ add a quote by Nick Hornby
item.description: "It's no good pretending that any relationship has a future if your record collections disagree violently or if your favorite films wouldn't even speak to each other if they met at a party." -- Nick Hornby

item.title: Apollos.Dark.Eden_ add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Tax not so bad a voice to slander music any more than once." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Apollos.Dark.Eden_ add a quote by Bob Dylan
item.description: "And I'll stand on the ocean until I start sinking." -- Bob Dylan

item.title: Apollos.Dark.Eden_ add a quote by Steven Morrissey
item.description: "If you must write prose or poems, the words you use should be your own. Don't plagiarize or take 'on loan'. There's always someone, somewhere, with a big nose, who knows, who'll trip you up and laugh when you fall." -- Steven Morrissey

item.title: Apollos.Dark.Eden_ add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Darkness cannot drive out darkness: only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate: only love can do that." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Apollos.Dark.Eden_ add a quote by Andrew Wolfe
item.description: "A book without words is like love without a kiss; it's empty." -- Andrew Wolfe

item.title: Apollos.Dark.Eden_ add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "Love never dies a natural death. It dies because we don't know how to replenish its source. It dies of blindness and errors and betrayals. It dies of illness and wounds; it dies of weariness, of witherings, of tarnishings." -- Anais Nin

item.title: Apollos.Dark.Eden_ add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "It is not a lack of love, but a lack of friendship that makes unhappy marriages." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Apollos.Dark.Eden_ add a quote by Stephen Chbosky
item.description: "We accept the love we think we deserve." -- Stephen Chbosky

item.title: Apollos.Dark.Eden_ add a quote by David Byrne
item.description: "Sometimes it's a form of love just to talk to somebody that you have nothing in common with and still be fascinated by their presence." -- David Byrne

item.title: Apollos.Dark.Eden_ add a quote by Ursula K. Le Guin
item.description: "Love doesn't just sit there, like a stone, it has to be made, like bread; remade all the time, made new." -- Ursula K. Le Guin

item.title: Apollos.Dark.Eden_ add a quote by Zelda Fitzgerald
item.description: "Nobody has ever measured, not even poets, how much the heart can hold." -- Zelda Fitzgerald

item.title: Apollos.Dark.Eden_ add a quote by Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
item.description: "The love of learning, the sequestered nooks, And all the sweet serenity of books" -- Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

item.title: Apollos.Dark.Eden_ add a quote by W. Somerset Maugham
item.description: "The great tragedy of life is not that men perish, but that they cease to love." -- W. Somerset Maugham

item.title: Apollos.Dark.Eden_ add a quote by Milan Kundera
item.description: "You can't measure the mutual affection of two human beings by the number of words they exchange." -- Milan Kundera

item.title: Apollos.Dark.Eden_ add a quote by Tom Stoppard
item.description: "It is a defect of God's humor that he directs our hearts everywhere but to those who have a right to them." -- Tom Stoppard

item.title: Apollos.Dark.Eden_ add a quote by James A. Baldwin
item.description: "Love does not begin and end the way we seem to think it does. Love is a battle, love is a war; love is a growing up." -- James A. Baldwin

item.title: Apollos.Dark.Eden_ add a quote by Alfred Lord Tennyson
item.description: "Tis better to have loved and lost Than never to have loved at all." -- Alfred Lord Tennyson

item.title: Apollos.Dark.Eden_ add a quote by William Goldman
item.description: "Just because you're beautiful and perfect, it's made you conceited." -- William Goldman

item.title: Apollos.Dark.Eden_ add a quote by Mary Zimmerman
item.description: "Let me die the moment my love dies. Let me not outlive my own capacity to love. Let me die still loving, and so, never die." -- Mary Zimmerman

item.title: Apollos.Dark.Eden_ add a quote by William Goldman
item.description: "The Queen's Pride was his ship, and he loved her. (That was the way his sentences always went: It is raining today and I love you. My cold is better and I love you. Say hello to Horse and I love you. Like that.)" -- William Goldman

item.title: Apollos.Dark.Eden_ add a quote by Mary Zimmerman
item.description: "A: The soul wanders in the dark, until it finds love. And so, wherever our love goes, there we find our soul. Q: It always happens? A: If we're lucky. And if we let ourselves be blind. Q: Instead of watching out? A: Instead of always watching out." -- Mary Zimmerman
